Description: The extraordinary heterogeneity of virtually all human cancers drives the acquisition of new disease traits and constitutes a formidable barrier to long-lasting remissions in the clinic. This process reflects a state of continuous tumor evolution, where hundreds of malignant clones are constantly in cooperation and competition with each other in a mostly unfavorable microenvironment to select fitness traits of adaptation and plasticity in cellular responses. The session will provide an overview of tumor plasticity and its implications for disease progression, unravel novel biochemical and signaling cascades of metabolic reprogramming and integrated stress response that drive the rise of new, more aggressive cancer traits, including metastatic competence, and discuss emerging therapeutic opportunities to prevent adaptive resistance to treatment.
Title: Tumor Adaption And Plasticity
